verses.verse: For everything there is a season<WH2165>, and a time<WH2165> for every purpose<WH2656> under heaven<WH8064>:
a time<WH6256> to be born<WH3205>, and a time<WH6256> to die<WH4191>; a time<WH6256> to plant<WH5193>, and a time<WH6256> to pluck up<WH6131> that which is planted<WH5193>;
a time<WH6256> to kill<WH2026>, and a time<WH6256> to heal<WH7495>; a time<WH6256> to break down<WH6555>, and a time<WH6256> to build up<WH1129>;
a time<WH6256> to weep<WH1058>, and a time<WH6256> to laugh<WH7832>; a time<WH6256> to mourn<WH5594>, and a time<WH6256> to dance<WH7540>;

a time<WH6256> to cast away<WH7993> stones<WH68>, and a time<WH6256> to gather<WH3664> stones<WH68> together<WH3664>; a time<WH6256> to embrace<WH2263>, and a time<WH6256> to refrain<WH7368> from embracing<WH2263>;
a time<WH6256> to seek<WH1245>, and a time<WH6256> to lose<WH6>; a time<WH6256> to keep<WH8104>, and a time<WH6256> to cast away<WH7993>;
a time<WH6256> to rend<WH7167>, and a time<WH6256> to sew<WH8609>; a time<WH6256> to keep silence<WH2814>, and a time<WH6256> to speak<WH1696>;
a time<WH6256> to love<WH157>, and a time<WH6256> to hate<WH8130>; a time<WH6256> for war<WH4421>, and a time<WH6256> for peace<WH7965>.
What profit<WH3504> hath he that worketh<WH6213> in that wherein<WH834> he laboreth<WH6001>?
I have seen<WH7200> the travail<WH6045> which God<WH430> hath given<WH5414> to the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> to be exercised therewith<WH6031>.

He hath made<WH6213> everything beautiful<WH3303> in its time<WH6256>: also he hath set<WH5414> eternity<WH5769> in their heart<WH3820>, yet so that<WH1097> man<WH120> cannot find out<WH4672> the work<WH4639> that<WH1097> God<WH430> hath done from the beginning<WH7218> even to the end<WH5490>.
I know<WH3045> that there is nothing better<WH2896> for them<WH8055>, than to rejoice, and to do<WH6213> good<WH2896> so long as they live<WH2416>.
And also that every man<WH120> should eat<WH398> and drink<WH8354>, and enjoy<WH7200> good<WH2896> in all his labor<WH5999>, is the gift<WH4991> of God<WH430>.

I know<WH3045> that<WH430>, whatsoever God doeth<WH6213>, it shall be for ever<WH5769>: nothing<WH369> can be put<WH3254> to it<WH1639>, nor anything taken from it<WH430>; and God hath done<WH6213> it<WH3372>, that men should fear before him<WH6440>.
That which is<WH3528> hath been long ago<WH3528>; and that which is to be hath long ago been<WH430>: and God seeketh<WH1245> again that which is passed away<WH7291>.

And moreover I saw<WH7200> under the sun<WH8121>, in the place<WH4725> of justice<WH4941>, that wickedness<WH7562> was there<WH4725>; and in the place of righteousness<WH6664>, that wickedness was there<WH7562>.
I said<WH559> in my heart<WH3820>, God<WH430> will judge<WH8199> the righteous<WH6662> and the wicked<WH7563>; for there is a time<WH6256> there for every purpose<WH2656> and for every work<WH4639>.

I said<WH559> in my heart<WH3820>, It is because<WH1700> of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120>, that God<WH430> may prove<WH1305> them<WH7200>, and that they may see that they<WH1992> themselves are but as beasts<WH929>.

For that which befalleth<WH4745> the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> befalleth<WH4745> beasts<WH929>; even one thing<WH259> befalleth<WH4745> them<WH4194>: as the one dieth, so dieth<WH4194> the other<WH2088>; yea<WH259>, they have all one breath<WH7307>; and man<WH120> hath no preeminence<WH4195> above the beasts<WH929>: for all is vanity<WH1892>.
All go<WH1980> unto one<WH259> place<WH4725>; all are of the dust<WH6083>, and all turn<WH7725> to dust<WH6083> again<WH7725>.

Who knoweth<WH3045> the spirit<WH7307> of man<WH1121>, whether it goeth<WH5927> upward<WH4605>, and the spirit<WH7307> of the beast<WH929>, whether it goeth<WH3381> downward<WH4295> to the earth<WH776>?

Wherefore I saw<WH7200> that there is nothing better<WH2896>, than that a man<WH120> should rejoice<WH8055> in his works<WH4639>; for that is his portion<WH2506>: for who shall bring<WH935> him back to see<WH7200> what shall be after him<WH310>?
